title: Box<Fn(&'a ())> not behaving contravariantly in 'a
body:
`&fn(&'a ())`, `Box<fn(&'a ())>`, and `&Fn(&'a ())` are all contravariant in `'a`. Shouldn’t `Box<Fn<&'a ()>>` be as well?

```rust
fn test1<'a, 'b: 'a>(f: &'b fn(&'a ())) -> &'b fn(&'b ()) {
    f  // ok
}

fn test2<'a, 'b: 'a>(f: Box<fn(&'a ())>) -> Box<fn(&'b ())> {
    f  // ok
}

fn test3<'a, 'b: 'a>(f: &'b Fn(&'a ())) -> &'b Fn(&'b ()) {
    f  // ok
}

fn test4<'a, 'b: 'a>(f: Box<Fn(&'a ())>) -> Box<Fn(&'b ())> {
    f  // error
}
```

```
error[E0308]: mismatched types
  --> /tmp/test.rs:14:5
   |
14 |     f
   |     ^ lifetime mismatch
   |
   = note: expected type `std::ops::Fn(&'b ()) + 'static`
              found type `std::ops::Fn(&'a ()) + 'static`
note: the lifetime 'a as defined on the body at 13:60...
  --> /tmp/test.rs:13:61
   |
13 |   fn test4<'a, 'b: 'a>(f: Box<Fn(&'a ())>) -> Box<Fn(&'b ())> {
   |  _____________________________________________________________^ starting here...
14 | |     f
15 | | }
   | |_^ ...ending here
note: ...does not necessarily outlive the lifetime 'b as defined on the body at 13:60
  --> /tmp/test.rs:13:61
   |
13 |   fn test4<'a, 'b: 'a>(f: Box<Fn(&'a ())>) -> Box<Fn(&'b ())> {
   |  _____________________________________________________________^ starting here...
14 | |     f
15 | | }
   | |_^ ...ending here

error: aborting due to previous error
```

(Possibly related to #36667?)
